intro: Lacistema myricoides, commonly known as the Mexican candlewood, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that resemble those of a maple tree. It produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
